intro: Chisocheton montanus, commonly known as the mountain chisocheton, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, woody fruits. The species is often found in lowland to montane forests, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments.
